result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: *Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*No contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

*NO contact with victim Veronica C. unless approved by court or agent.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No contact order.

*Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and A course in anger management.
*Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

*AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment. 
*Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
*Stayed pending review. Probation review hearing scheduled for 12/11/15 at 1:30pm.
**04-01-16/PRH, defendant is non-compliance with probation conditions and is ordered to serve 3 days in HOC; STRAIGHT TIME, with No Good Time Credit.

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Sworn as interpreter:  Daniel Lopez
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Brian Burke.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sworn as interpreter: Daniel Lopez.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed on 3-11-16:  Decision and Order Denying Motion to Allow Visits with Children.

*copy to District Attorney and Attorney Rick D. Steinberg*
Per email from Probation Agent, case to be scheduled for probation review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for 4-01-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.

Per email from Agent Juan Ramos, defendant continues to remain in custody on ICE hole at Dodge County Detention Facility.  Matter removed from review calendar.  If and when defendant is released agent is to contact the court for a review.

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez not in court, defendant in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody at Dodge County Detention Facility on a BICE detainer.  Next review date 1-8-2016 at 1:15.  Agent Ramos advised of date.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Letter in response to motion to allow child visitation.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
Defendant's motion to allow visits wth his children, received in 15CM000561, 15CM000743 and 15CM001331.

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Ruth Garcia. Sentencing Proceeded. Statements made by parties and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and A course in anger management.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Veronica C. unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Sworn as interpreter:  Ruth Garcia.   mld

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter: Ruth Garcia.
AS TO CHARGE: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-13-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Veronica C. or children, no possession of firearms or dangerous weapons and cooperate with Justice Point Supervision.   mld
Sworn as interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.   mld

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as Spanish Interpreter Enrique Barbosa.
Court consented to Attorney Rick Steinberg be substituted as counsel for Attorney Ed Borda on case 2015CM1331.  Defense counsel is in receipt of all the discovery for the (3) three cases.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-17-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Veronica C., until further order of the Court.   mld
Court ordered that the defendant is not allowed to have contact the children in common with the victim.   mld

Attorney Rick David Steinberg in court, defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was present and taken into custody by Milwaukee Police Department.  Victim was present on 4-15-2015 to address the no contact order.  Based on the contact by defendant through child to victim and a vial to be tested by the Crime lab, that was provided to child by defendant, Court ordered that defendant is not allowed to contact the children in common.  Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-21-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Victim was present.  Due to Branch 4 in trial, case adjourned for Hearing on No Contact Order in Branch 4 on 4-16-2015 at 10:00 am and Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-21-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez in court with attorney Rick David Steinberg.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-15-2015 at 8:30 am.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Attorney Rick David Steinberg in court, defendant Carlos A Vargas-Sanchez not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Defendant was just arrested and is currently in custody, per defense counsel.  Defense counsel will get the discovery and an offer from the State.  Upon the request of defense counsel, case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-19-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Veronica C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
UPON RELEASED DEFENDANT WILL NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
